name: Frozen Synapse
description: Brings the simultaneous turn-based strategy genre up-to-date and lets you give detailed, accurate orders to your squad.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7 Processor: 1.6 GHz Memory: 512 MB Graphics: Netbook integrated graphics DirectX®:  Hard Drive: 220 MB Sound:

reviews.review_text: This is one of the most intelligent games ever created. Like chess, it requires careful planning and predicting the moves of your opponent. Unlike chess, it does not require years of training to play at the world-class level.  Don't buy if you dislike thinking.  Definitely buy if you're looking for a fun challenge for your brain.

Okay, so I'm not much of a tactical person, but Frozen Synapse is a lot of fun. Planning out your exact next moves and seeing what the enemy could do in certain situations... and then the rush of seeing everything actually unfold.... It really is a lot of fun. And it's really nice to listen to.
Better controls than the prime version.
Never played a better Tactical Strategy Game. Easy to learn very hard to master.

Don't let the looks of this game shy you away, it is one of the most unique indie projects released in my gaming experience. A notable feature that's standing out is the fact that the strategy turn-by-turn factor is in fact taking place simultaneously. In other words, you don't react to someone's turn, you guess what will the do next. This changes the whole mechanic of turn-by-turn strategy games, offering something new, fresh that guarantees an enjoyable, fun and rewarding experience throught. Oh, and the music is a nice techno styled, matrix kind of thingy.

Have you ever wanted to play a game where your tactical thinking was rewarded without having too much hassle or any difficult mechanics to grasp? Yes? Then this is the game for you.  Frozen Synapse is an absolute wonderful tactical battlefield commander game. You are able to control several of your soldiers on a randomly generated map against either a human or AI player and lead them, showing whether they should duck or stand up, engage or continue on sight, time their actions, etc., all in hopes to out-think your opponent and guess what they will do. You are given planning phases which, although they may be lengthy, give you the chance to test every possible scenerio to your liking, giving you the ultimate think session of your life every turn.  Frozen Synapse also has great co-op in it's expansion pack, which gives you the same tactical fun with a friend. I highly recommend you get it - it's called Red Mode, or something like that. Another great feature this game has is the ability to play multiple games at a time. You get popup invites from other people, which you can either accept or deny, into their games, which allows you to play however many games you want to play over any period of time you like, which leads to the bad parts about this game.  I'm not going to lie, this game isn't perfect. There's no punishing system for abandoning games, which happens a little too often with bad mannered players who don't want to finish a losing game. Not only that, but It does have two or more glitches (you can plan to move your soldier through a wall, but the game says that you can't do that, and an extra move when trying to walk beside a wall, really nothing that major or game-breaking) which can annoy you a little, but it won't consistantly happen to you.   My final verdict for Frozen Synapse is this - if you are a fan of thinking games, especially chess, GET THIS GAME IMMEDIATELY. If you are not, wait for a sale, because you very well might enjoy this game for it's easy-to-understand, but hard-to-master mechanics. A solid NINE out of TEN from me on this wonderful game.

This is a rather bare bones game, visually, but in its simplicity lies some great gameplay mechanics and a turn-based system that benefits both the hyper-casual and hard core players. Definately worth a try.
very fun game, I highly recommend it!
Fantastic game with an even more fantastic soundtrack.

Back when I first started playing Rainbow 6, I tried to plan my missions and let the teams execute the plans without my intervention. That never worked, but in Frozen Synapse, you get a chance to re-plan every five seconds of game time. The result is a tense, quick play experience -- this game is a thing of beauty.

An impressive cyberpunk cqc simulator, around the bones of simultaneous-turn tactical gameplay. Like in real life, planning takes up vastly more time than execution. You can spend half an hour in Frozen Synapse fine-tuning your squad's movements and your planning will amount to five seconds of actual combat. Despite how long you can spend planning, the games can be over very quickly. While built for multiplayer, it possesses an extensive single-player campaign. For anyone who fancies themselves a tactician.
Hard to find a better turn based squad shooter RTS. Smart execution based on previous strategies makes the superior controls even superiorer. AI is a force to be reckoned with.

A cerebral puzzler. The core concept is very easy to get down, but executing your plans is surprisingly hard... it requires you to put on your thinking cap and plan several moves ahead, just like Chess.  Definitely something you could play for hours, though. And the soundtrack is top-notch.
This game will help you relax while you fry your brain.

The game is truly something else. If not a masterpiece, it comes damn close. After playing it for about 150 hours, i cannot recommend this enough. The game is both very advanced and yet it's simplicity itself. It is one of those 'why the hell did no one make this before?' kind of moments.  I highly recommend this game to anyone that loves tactics and strategic games, this includes games like chess. The number of unique moves in this game by far outnumbers the moves possible in chess. There is no way two matches in this game is ever going to look the same, you need to consider your every little move you do.  Combined with a very nice soundtrack that almost perfectly sets the mood of the game i simply say this:  This is one of the best indie games ever made, buy it!.

if u like strategy, get this game; if you want to try a military style game thats different to the usual cod schlock get this game, if you are a cod/halo/fps fan who thinks this game sucks because it's not fast paced enough and the weapon selection is limited and the strategy approach is boring and there isnt any killstreaks, go ♥♥♥♥ yourself

Haven't played the game long, just picked it up, couldn't beat the on-sale price tag. :) I'm just getting started and so far am truly enjoying the game. The dynamics of game play are a lot of fun, it's cool to be able to utilize units to work with one another to help neutralize hostiles.

if u like strategy, get this game; if you want to try a military style game thats different to the usual cod schlock get this game, if you are a cod/halo/fps fan who thinks this game sucks because it's not fast paced enough and the weapon selection is limited and the strategy approach is boring and there isnt any killstreaks, go ♥♥♥♥ yourself
I wish I wasn't dumb
The control mechanism took me a little while to learn, but the gameplay is amazingly satisfying!  Turn-based strategy heaven.
This game is freaking amazing. PLAY IT!

This is a game that rewards skilful play by not only success, but just making you look and feel awesome. The punchy sound effects and great music make it very enjoyable to watch your plan perfectly unfold.

A great strategy game, in my opinion, comparable to Company of Heroes, but definitely has it's own unique gameplay and strategies. If you like strategy games, then I'd definitely recommend this game for you. Having an extra copy for a friend makes the game that much more fun, it definitely is more fun when you play with a friend.

Great strategy game that really racks the brain. Have played for less than an hour and I'm already in love with this game. Definately buying at the 80% reduced rate, not sure if with the $25 pricetag, but it's sure looking like it will be.
It is a unique game, with an interesting combination of shooter and strategy

Woah... I dunno what to say. I've just played the most amazing game in my life. I mean this is the real deal, the real 100/100, the game of the year and also the game of the decade in the last 10 decades. This is basically where all the development in gaming technology has led us, this is it. It won't get any better than this. I could go on for DAYS praising the amazing visuals, inventive art style (love that blue, so NICE!!!!) and the interesting and most importantly ___FUN___ GAMEPLAY but I'm in loss of words. I don't wanna live in a world where every single living person.. no.. ORGANISM is not playing this game... This is too much for me too handle. I'm trying to get the word out but... I'm just one man... SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT THIS GAME, LET THE WORLD KNOW!!!
The game is cool, but probably the best reason for you to buy it is that i suck hard at it. Anyone could own me
Games don't get more tactically strategic than this.
SOMEONE TELL OSCAR TO PLAY THIS GAME WITH ME AGAIN!
soory :((( its hard and bad gaem ;(D:
this sucks
Got addicted to it during free weekend.  Stalked the store page.   Buying it as i write this.  11/10
23 euros for this game is a very high price, even despite the fact that this game is quite good. I'd say to pick it up if you can get a discount.
pretty cool, like the swat of the future. I beat it.
Best soundtrack ever, fun and addicting gameplay.
IT FUN
the controls are a bit complicated
10/10 would freeze again.
It alright
Interesting strategy!
It's Laser Squad Nemesis for idiots. That still makes it quite clever.
May not be the most gorgeous game out there but two thumbs up for some deep turn-based strategy.  Wait... where's my other thumb!?
Really good if you like turn based strategys

Frozen Synapse never gets boring. For me it's the optimal multiplayer experience. Whenever I have some time on my hands I sit down and do my turns. There's also an iPad version. So when you really have to go to the toilet, you can just continue the game you started on PC on your iPad.
The modern chess, that's all.

A tactics masterpiece, Frozen Synapse relies on its simultaneous turn-based system for its refreshing take on tactical squad warfare. This system is well conceived and well implemented, adding a layer of tension and uncertainty which is not often found in the chess-like world of turn based strategy. With a tangled web of political intrigue on the solo player front, and an immense userbase for both online and local multiplayer you'll never run out of challenges.
A unique and intense turn-based strategy game. Not for the weak of heart.

Frozen Synapse is what you get when you try to combine a strategy game like starcraft with turn based mechanic. What makes this game unique is that it lets you simulate enamy movement which opens your mind to possibillities and multiple actions you can take to achieve victory. The singleplayer aspect of the game as far the story part is kinda weak but the game was not ment for singleplayer it was ment to be played with humans and their tedency to exploit or be unpredictable unlike the A.I.'s. Something else that makes the game unique is the procedurally generated levels this ensure that the game is not allways play the same.   Final Verdict 4/5
It's like chess... but badass!
Get this game if you enjoy tactics in anyway, it's amazing! Just look it up on Youtube or the net, but I highly advise that you buy it.
Mindnumbingly awesome. Randomly generated maps keeps you guessing even when replaying levels you have lost to. I still have yet to beat the last level though...

Frozen Synapse is not a game for everyone. It's a game about strategy. It's a game about patience. It's a game with an extremely high learning curve.  Played in bird's eye view, Frozen Synapse puts the player in the role of a commander of a squad equipped with a shotgun, rifle, or rocket launcher. While their weapons differ, their move sets remain largely the same.  In turn based fashion, each round is spent instructing individual units where, when, and how to move, aim, and shoot. Only by tactically queuing up their actions is victory achievable. This complex but rewarding gameplay mechanic will likely drive casual players away.  Once instructions are given, the player enters the 'Prime' phase where his and his opponent's squads execute their given tasks.  Mode7's masterpiece is unlike anything I've ever played. It's a deep and rewarding experience. Despite my inability to master the mechanics, I can't deny the brilliance of this turn based strategy game.  Grade: B+

Solid turn based strategy game!  The game is based on two distinct 'phases'. During the planning phase, you and your enemy both take turns giving your units commands and directions for a span of about 8 seconds, then once your orders have been issued, both sets of instructions play out in real time (the results phase). Once the carnage of those crucial seconds play out, you are once again issuing your troops their orders.  Very fun to hop in and out of as each game tends to be 5 - 10 minutes in length.  I give this a score of 82%

The only strategy game of it's kind. A turn-based game that extends the limits of all other strategy games out there! It's simplistic look and clever design mixed with all the possibilites of intuition, scripting, and logic make it a one-of-a-kind instant success for any strategy game fan!

Simply fantastic. Solid tactical gameplay, and the multiplayer implementation is flawless - it's pretty much all the advantages of PBEM with none of its issues. And you get two copies of the game when you buy it.
Mindnumbingly awesome. Randomly generated maps keeps you guessing even when replaying levels you have lost to. I still have yet to beat the last level though...

Turn-based tactical combat. Be devious, plan out every move based on your opponents, and then watch your men die when the shotgunner you forgot about walked in a wrecks your plans. This game is awesome.

Asynchronous turn-based strategy game heavily reminiscent of the old mission planner from Rainbow Six. You give orders to barely functional mens who then try in every way possibly to ruin your plan by getting themselves shot and/or blown up by the other guy's mens.  Extremely high depth of play, extremely simple (if at time frustrating) mechanics. If you play this game, i will play with/against you. Unfortunately, the multiplayer servers are typically a little on the empty side.

A turn-based classic. Simple visuals keep things clear for the player, and constantly obsessing over the opponents next move is absolutely nail biting. A must have for any gamer who loves tactics. Also, the soundtrack rocks your eardrums. Buy it whenever you have the money.

Awesome, tense strategy game with more atmosphere than a game with such simple graphics ought to have. Great sense of humor, great multiplayer, great mix of realtime and turn-based strategy. Check it out.
I'm bad at this game, and I should feel bad, but it's still so much fun. It's like Chess if your opponent's queen has an RPG and can blow your king up on the first move.
This game is great fun - little tricky to get your head around initially, but once you're in it's a blast!
good and simple
I also recommend St. Ives Apricot Scrub for blemishes and black heads.

an inetersting take on turn based tacitle combate that acctually works really well, the best soundtrack i've ever heard in a videogame, combined with great humor. oh and it should aslo work on the most minimalistic rigs. i personally didnt expect much of this game but ended up loving it
It takes 20 minutes to plan a turn but only 5 seconds to lose it all. Are you ready for the heat, or will you have to step out of the kitchen?

IT’S COLD GAME. ICY AS ♥♥♥♥. COLD IS A REVENGE BEST SERVED DISH. BUT WHY YOU ASK? WELL, IF A TREE FALLS ON THE GROUND, AND NO ONE HEARS IT, DOES IT MAKE A FREEZE? OF COURSE IT DOES. BECAUSE I THINK THIS GAME IS CHILLIING.( AS ♥♥♥♥) SO ALLOW ME TO BREAK THE ICE, AND PRESENT YOU TO FROZEN SYNAPES. IT’S FINGER LICKING COLD.
mental time lapse causes subtle but suave change in temperature which ultimately causes a relAPSE (synapse) and then there are rocket launchers and guns and smgs which are slow but steady
Why cant I just buy one copy? The concept of us buying two for no reason and making us pay $25 is absurd. I want one copy cheap. The game seems fantastic, do recommend.

Good game. Very smart but it missed one MASSIVE trick that made me not play it all the way through.  When you go to execute your command there is a loading screen that just breaks the gameplay a lot. I would have really played the hell out of this if it was a little more connected instead of taking you away from the action. Quite a hard game with an awesome sound track too.
Get this game if you enjoy tactics in anyway, it's amazing! Just look it up on Youtube or the net, but I highly advise that you buy it.

Its not one of those 'strategy games' where the strategist with the bigger gun wins, this one actually makes you think, makes every move count so you have to calculate every step so you dont waste it.
This Is a really fun game which can be played on the go or while watching youtube (etc). I recommend it on sale, 25$ is a hefty price to pay for this game.
I dont understant this 'game'. It's a stupid for me!
Commit your tactical decisions and watch in despair as it falls apart in seconds.
Super Fun wish I could buy it
a very good stratagy game all should play
'Frozen Synapse' is a very awesome game you will love it its a top down shooter (get it on april 19, 2014 for $5 not $25!)
Great :)
This should come to every mobile phone and tablet available with hybrid support to the pc version. Damn that would even kick more ♥♥♥ than it kicks ♥♥♥ now.
If you tink you know Tactics, think again! Frozen Synapse will test your mind and your ability to guess your opponent's next move!
I recommend this game because it gets me a prize in the great gift pile.

If you are a fan of strategy and top down view games or cyber-punk, then this is a great blend for you. The game revolves around you sending virtual units around randomly generated building interiors to fight for whatever objective is set for that mission.  The interface allows you to make complex orders relatively effortlessly with just the touch of the left and right mouse buttons. Queueing orders up and then hitting the turn button to see the outcome.... or giving orders to your enemies units to see what you think they will do and then getting a simulated outcome to judge your tactics in relation to what you think the enemy will do.   Trial and error gameplay, smoothe interface, beautiful art style and elegant multiplayer system. Try it out.
This game is pretty difficult, but the fun in it is trying to predict your enemy's moves and act accodringly. 9/10 would reccommend.

If you like a brilliant, tactical, squad-based shooter. If you like turn-based, PBeM-ish accessability. If you like a great soundtrack. If you like randomly-generated level layouts for replayability. If you like solid multiplayer and a 55-level singleplayer campaign. If you like a game with plenty of depth and options. If you like an easy to use multiplayer lobby and community section.  Then I hope you've already got Frozen Synapse, or you're missing out, big style.
This type of game never caught me, but the fluid turn based combat is interesting and I would not hesitate to recommend it based off of the creative game play, music, and simplicity.
Awesome Tactical game, I recommend it!
A fun mix of Chess and violence.
WTF is Frozen Synapse?  Its a round based strategy game, really intense, great music.  Take a look at that video:         YouTube™ Video:  WTF Is... - Frozen Synapse ?

Quite an interesting and unique spin on turn based strategy games. The game is fairly simple and straightforward, but planning out moves can take a while (if you get really in depth). You don't even have to be around for the entire match, and can log back on at intervals in order to plan out turns over time. I've enjoyed this game so far, though I will admit, it occasionally doesn't seem to follow its own rules and my characters seem to die in situations that they shouldn't.
Far and away the best turn based game out today. Blows things like BloodBowl and the like right outta the water. Learning curve though in order to become effective (something I'm still trying to do)
I really like the game, but I couldnt find the stupid cake.
I don't know what you have to do. How to play.
A game of tactical brilliance. Good stuff.
This is an excellent strategy game.
the game is quite cool about strategy.... i like it
its a good game :)

I really like this game because of its strategic purity. You can spend as much or as little time with your strategies as you want, and the results pretty directly match your skill and effort. It's like running your own hand-crafted simulations to outwit your opponent. Also, the soundtrack is very fitting, which makes it very easy to spend a ton of time planning.
I read about this in GameInformer. Still looking for that issue to see what changed since then. Awesome strategy game.
chess with guns! :D

Set in the far future, Frozen Synapse places you in the role of a tactican who's tasked with giving orders to bio organic robot soldiers called Shapeforms on a mission to help a resistance group, Petrov's Shard, take down a corporation called Enyo:Nomad who are ruling the city of Markov Geist with an iron fist, you will learn more about the world of Frozen Synapse through the files you can review prior to a mission as well as listening to the conversations between the characters, some are even sentient AIs. The game plays out like a turn based strategy game, except it allows you to run simulations of what the enemies might do, but it may very likely not end up being as the simulation predicted and you have to gamble if you're willing to take the risk or just rethink everything.

This is a really intresting game that has a slow tempo but an action and excitement level higher than any FPS game I've ever seen. The way I best can describe it is as an urban-modern version of 'Chess'. Strongly recommended to anyone who got any interest in tactics.

Fun simultaneous turn-based tactical game with a really detailed and easy to use UI. It's tough as nails, but a blast to play. Plus, you can play a turn and leave the game, or play multiple games at once if you're waiting on your opponent's turn.

Arguably one of the most important indie titles to date, Frozen synapse is a masterclass in tactical realtimeturnbasedsquadtacticalshootermckitchensink genre gamplay. A clean interface hides some of the most tactically deep strategy play that will keep you coming back for more.  Boasting an incredible soundtrack, lush visuals, addictive gamplay, and - above all - a cool name, Frozen Synapse is worthy of your attention. Don't disappoint yourself. Get this game.

great tactics game. the music theme of the title screen is awesome, and the graohics look really nice. it isnt hard to play, which makes it fun for more experienced players, but for beginners too. it doesnt ask a lot of your computer, so if your pc doesnt have a good graphics card etc there is still a big change of that you can play the game on your computer. i really recommend this game for people who like tactic games.
Exercise your brain, controlling a team of soldiers to fit a purpose. Better than Chess!

Its like a light weight turn based game of chess (small and runs on my laptop).  When I first saw this game I thought it reminded me of the games by Introvision; aka.. Uplink, Defcon, Darwinina and Multiwinia. The graphics are simplistic and because of this you can quickly simulate every turn you make.  The point of the game is you give orders to your men, simulate your turn to make sure you don't die and then commit your turn. After you commit your turn the enemy makes their turn and they may (most likely) won't follow what you simulated.
Innovative gameplay, ive never played another game like this. If your unsure give the demo a try im sure it wont disapoint.
Like RoboRally but you're trying to kill each other. So exactly like RoboRally. But way cooler
Truly intelligent and smart game, makes you solve puzzles every minute. A perfect and minimalistic tactical strategy game with simple and cool controls.
A great tactical brain-tweaker.
Sweet techno beats

To say it in short: I love this game!   To say a bit more: It is a tactical turn based game where the turns are prepared simultaneously by the players. This game can be played online and offline, against the AI in skirmish mode or in a campaign as well as against other players from around the world. It can be nailbiting while you watch the outcome and realize all your awesome and unbeatable planning goes down the toilet as your opponent does exactly what you didn't think of. And on the other hand, the feeling is great when you watch your plan unfold and you stomp the opponent into the ground. But the best thing is, if things go awry and you lose, you always know it had nothing to do with luck but all with the mistakes you did. It is a bit like chess where you have to plan your moves into the future and adapt to the strategies of your opponent.   The units you (can) use range from machinegunners, to shotguns, rocket launcher and grenades to snipers and riot shilds. There are also differnt types of scenarios such as rescue hostages, secure a specific area or just plain extermination to name only a few.   The most important thing about this game is that you cannot just rush in and shoot blindly. You have to use a tactical approach and plan your moves carefully. Your units don't have many hitpoints as in classical shooters. One hit and they are dead biomass. Buildings and covers can be destroyed by rockets. So depending on the units there might be not a save spot to just sit and wait.   Another nice aspect of this game is, that you don't need to be permanently online. You can plan your moves offline. And soon as the turn result is there, you get notified of it and can prepare the next turn. So even for casual players who don't have much time, this is a good game to spend a few minutes for your turn and upload it.   I really hope this game gets more attention as it surly deserves it. The grafics in Tron style and the nice soundtrack are really catchy. Very nice is also, that when you buy a game, you also get a second one to send to a friend.   So would i recommend the game? Yes, definitely!

I've still barely played this, but I have to recommend it, because the game is glorious. This is chess with shotguns and rocket launchers! No... not chess... This is Go! (Go is of Chinese origin and offers even more strategic depth than Chess in many ways.) Graphics are simle, but actually look quite nice. Screenshots don't do them justice. Feels almost tronlike while playing.
If you like thinking it is perfect game for you.....
This game is about as pure of a strategy game that you can play.
A great little game, with a very small amount of active players making it hard to dive into.

I'm not very good at strategy games. Luckily for me, there's Frozen Synapse, a squad-based tactical game that's one of the most addictive indie titles I've played all year. The style of FS is quite nice, with a quasi-cyberpunk setting, a simplistic graphic style that recalls Metal Gear Solid's VR missions and an electronic soundtrack that's pretty impressive in its own right.   Matches can be lightning fast or last days a la chess. Such is the beauty of the turn-based gameplay in FS. The multiplayer community is robust as of this review, and I get plenty of invites whether I'm playing single player or multiplayer. The multiplayer community is great. In the few matches I've played (and lost), competitors have never hesitated to give me tips on strategy. Community aside, there some great features, such as 'light' and 'dark' modes (which determine fog of war) as well as instant Youtube uploads, giving you plenty of reference for strategy and a way to showcase your wins

This is a great turn based strategy game, where you control a squad and are paired up another squad controlled by another player. There is a lot of depth to this pretty simple game. You have to plan what your squad does, and anticipate what the enemy will do. You can watch any games you have played (or anyone has played for that matter) and see what the enemy team did, what you did, and what you could do to improve. You can even upload your games to youtube directly in game. This game is awesome.
This game is one of the best tactic focused games that I've ever played. Plenty of missions, and a virtually infinite longevity thanks to the multiplayer. A must-have for the fans of the genre.

Although it may look a little lack lustre, Frozen Synapse is in fact a very deep turn-based strategy in the vein of XCOM or Heroes of Might & Magic with a twist: once you and your opponent decide your units' moves, it becomes a real-time action sequence and your strategy goes against theirs. The story became gripping and the characters very interesting. It's a mix of corporate espionage, rebellion, and a war of beliefs coming together to make a fantastic singleplayer.  On the multiplayer side, it comes with the added benefit of being asynchronous (after you setup your strategy, you can wander off for hours while your opponent decides; kind of like chess by mail). The game modes are neat and varied and seting up a match is pretty easy. Another plus, the people I played against were gratious and felt like a great community.  Finally, after listening to the trailers, I decided to buy the soundtrack, and boy was it worth it! Still in my play list today.
I enjoy this game, and I've yet to win a match!  Just ignore the fact I'm rubbish and notice what good fun it is...then mock me.
You think chess is strategic? Chess is small time. Simultaneous turn-based real time strategy is where it's at.

This thing is raw stategy.   You have a squad of 'vatforms,' essentially clones into which orders can be plugged. You must provide those orders in this turn-based squad combat game. Except it doesn't feel so turn based, because after each planning phase where you meticulously plotted routes and arcs of fire for your units, all the action hashes out in real time.  The game basically does a bunch of behind the scenes math to come up with the result, taking into account cover, movement, range, wepon type, etc. After a bit, you catch on to the basic rules of who's going to survive a given one on one encounter, and you can start testing strategies by running real time simulations of enemy movements (with orders given by you based on what you think they might do) before you submit each turn.  Add to the rock solid core mechanics a compelling story, holographic computer simulation graphics style, and awesome soundtrack, and you have top notch game.  Did I mention there's procedurally generated maps and multiplayer?
Pretty great tactical simultanious turn based game. Don't think of it as a 2-pack, think of it as an extra free game!
Its cool. Hard to use but easy once you get it. PLAY THE TUTORIAL.

Never mind good for an indie game, this thing'd be good even as a full price release. Massively deep gameplay, HOURS of content (I'm up to 13 hours, so far), and the soundtrack is phenomenal. I can't recommend it highly enough.
Donated by STEAM_0:0:24955920
It's like chess... but badass!
This is a game of raw tactics. No reactions, nothing beyond mere chess with guns. Even though I suck at thinking, I had lots of fun with this beauty.
Really thoughtful. Give this a try if you want a break from the constant murdering and/or want a strategy game more focused on actual strategy than clickspeed and build orders.
Surprisingly good. Requires you to think and be a step ahead of your opponent.

I just realized I never wrote a recommendation for this game. I think I bought it shortly after release... when was that, two years ago? one year ago? Oh nvm, back to the recommendation. I'll try to keep it as short as possible. Well where to start? Imagine a virtual chess mixed with Rainbow Six. It's a 1 vs 1 skirmish most of the time, but the are other modes too. Every player is assigned different units with different strenghts and weaknesses, the map is randomized and can be played with fog of war or without. The game is very easy to learn, the interface does a great job, you can crouch, aim + walk, run without trying to engage, engage as soon as you see someone, ignore a specific enemy or just hide behind a window, all with simple commands/clicks. Nevertheless, it's a bit harder to master, to create good strategies and beat your opponent in a battle of warfare wits. There are no random numbers, no evasion or dice involved, everything is calculated perfectly (this is because these are not human soldiers, they are different entities explained by the story), even if it the graphics show you that the soldier is shooting randomly and seems to hit with only one of the random bullets, in reality, that's just a visual effect, there are specific rules when the 'killshot' is issued. Multiplayer is very nice, with friends or strangers, you can play your game like you would normally do, everyone doing their turn, or you can log out, your friend can do his turn, send it to server, and then you can continue the game when he's offline, for example. This allows you to play even two or more games simultaneously, jumping from one to another. Last thing is, the electric music is very soothing. If you like brewing strategies with a little group of soldiers, this is for you, don't miss it, you can even invite me to a game ^_^ .
This game is very relaxing, tactic fans can't go wrong with it.

An astounding simultaneous turn-based top-down tactical squad-shooter. All done in a sort of psuedo-retro style, like they thought games would look in the future in the 80s.   Players simultaneously plan out 5 seconds of movement for their squad, then when turns are submitted the outcome is revealed, and the next 5 seconds is planned. Very little randomness involved - firefights are won based on a consistent set of criteria around whether players are moving, behind cover, aiming, etc.  Campaign is pretty nice, but the multiplayer action is really where the fun is.

Don't be misled by the hours played. I played hundreds of hours of FS before it ever came to steam.  --The single player missions are pretty fun and decently challenging.  --The multiplayer is hands down the best PvP I've ever seen. No p2w. No grind. No hardware advantage. No hackers. Your wits are the only thing that matters.
Really good turn based strategy game. Go buy it.

Fantastic little strategy shooter. Simultaneous turn-based combat with no element of luck (ie predictable outcomes) results in a game that makes people who overthink everything like me spending 10 minutes trying to puzzle out a 5 second turn.  Tis good stuff.
Your face is dumb if you dont buy this game.

Frozen Synapse will make your head hurt, possibly in a good way. It's Flotilla with foot soldiers. You have a squad of guys who follow your orders to the letter; so does your enemy. The trick is you give orders in phases, and both sides execute their orders in real time. Ordered your men to walk up behind an enemy and blast him? Too bad, your enemy ordered that guy to turn around moments before you arrive.  It's pure tactics with no chance or twitch gaming in the way. Each battle is mathmatically solvable (To the point that you can simulate fights before you commit to your moves), there's no element of random here. It's a hard concept to wrap your head around, and you'll probably lose even the first single player mission many times before you get it, but once you do, there's multiple game modes, multiplayer, and an engrossing campaign to keep you hooked.
I had one sniper guy wipe out the whole enemy's squad and it was so satisfying.
It's bit hard to understand how to play, but it's a good game to train your brain!

The only strategy game of it's kind. A turn-based game that extends the limits of all other strategy games out there! It's simplistic look and clever design mixed with all the possibilites of intuition, scripting, and logic make it a one-of-a-kind instant success for any strategy game fan!
Great game. That's all.

You think you're bad? Bad ♥♥♥?   No you're not until you play this game. This game is all about TACTICS. No, not about how well you know openings or strageties in real time situation. This challenges us how good we are with pure mathematics, probility, and hard-core special ops shooter..  It's like Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear planning phase, but 10x better...haha...go play it..It's so freaking good..  If u ever wanted to be part of a special ops or anything..this is your game cause YOU'RE devising the strageties
Cool turn-based tactical game in the spirt of Breach and X-COM. The soundtrack alone is worth the price.

Date: 1/26/2016 Review Number: 1 Game: Frozen Synapse From (Creator Publisher): Mode7 Played On: Laptop (windowed mode) Steam Price as of Review: $24.99 Total Time played: About 45 Minutes Review: Okay, first review of the Year of Reviews, and the random number gods picked Frozen Synapse, a different take on the typical turn based combat slash RTS sort of game, a new take on a mechanic I haven’t seen before. The turn based combat thing is a thing I am generally fond of, and I will also admit to being a old hand at Warcraft 2, though I never spent a lot of time on the third. The gameplay here is a unique take combining both types of games, breaking down combat into five second turns and processing each user’s movements simultaneously between turns.   The control scheme in order to facilitate this sort of control, movement, and aiming for multiple pieces on the ‘board’, can get a little complex, but the tutorial does a decent job of giving you a solid overview of the play controls, and the fact that each turn can be looped and played while you are setting it up and moving around all your little pieces means you have plenty of time to fiddle around with the specifics for each of your characters, though I feel like more than an hour of messing around with the specific aiming direction of four little blue pawns would start to grate on my nerves, satisfying bullet-flying notwithstanding.  Storywise I don’t foresee anything unique happening based on my opening sample. Essentially, the story you get early on in the game is that you are a computer program designed to maneuver other computer programs to take out other computer programs that may or may not be real people. It seems like it would be enough to keep you engaged between loading screens, but then again, I didn’t play Starcraft for the storylines either, I played it to zerg rush Terrans until they were forced to pick up all their buildings and fly away into a corner.  All in all, I feel like this game would be good if you are the sort of person who plays RTS games where you pause every few moments to get your bearings, or feel like chess or checkers isn’t fluid enough for you. Good for a way to waste some strategy gaming time if you have it.  Game’s fate: Uninstalled. Though I enjoy RTS/turn based combat games, and this one is certainly a take I haven’t seen before, I’ll pass on keeping this around for now.  Buy/No Buy: At full price, I can’t see putting that kind of investment into it, though if it was on sale, I would certainly buy again, and I know this one goes on sale quite often, so wishlist it if you’re interested.
Frozen Synapse, was a gift from a friend (2 for 1), and whenever I launch my gifted copy, it automatically closes itself out.
Its a great game and a multi choice of tactics :)
Best game on steam. Too bad so few play it.
A surprisingly intellectual game based solely on tactics. No single 'answer' or strategy to the game, just your own personal style. If you like to think, plan and predict... Then this is for you.
This is THE tactical game you want to play.

Chess meets worms but the turns are taken at the same time.  Get inside your opponents' heads, predict where they're going to send their troops, then blast 'em, snipe 'em, spray 'em or mow 'em down with your different units.  This game is unlike any other for its time and its sequel (not Prime) is currently in development, I really like this series and if you find yourself curious about it then I think you just might like it too.
It's a very interesting and challenging game
Great game, never finished it.

You know what makes chess the ultimate strategy game that has lasted for thousands of years? Its simplicity.   Frozen Synapse takes the turn-based strategy game genre to an extreme level of meticulousness. This is saying something in a genre that already resembles something like chess with more rules.  I am a long-time fan of turn-based strategy games, with the X-Com iterations holding a special place in my heart (well just the first two and the remake actually), so I am no stranger to intricate control over characters and exhaustive planning for each turn. However, there are two questions that must be answered in the affirmative for any TBS game to be considered 'good': First, are the controls efficient? Second, is the game fun?  Unfortunately, Frozen Synapse fails on both accounts. The painstaking level of control over every minute movement of your troops is maddening and superfluous. You are the most anal-retentive military commander in all of history, and while the game provides a reasonable explanation for it, your troops are apparently mindless drones. Simply adding more controls over every little movement does not make a TBS game superior to others. Extraneous controls weaken a strategy game's enjoyability by obstructing its very purpose: strategy. Very often, you will find yourself losing rounds/games because you forgot to set a drone to look in a specific direction or to duck at the right moment, or walk quickly/slowly. Not because you didn't realize that those moves were necessary, no, because you FORGOT. There are so many options to set for each individual unit, that you can easily spend an hour just setting up a SINGLE TURN. I am not exaggerating, the multiplayer gives opponents a week to post their turn! This kind of burdening complexity removes the players ability to strategize and gives advantage to the player who is most able to memorize details. Strategy is about out-thinking your opponent's moves and countering them, or recovering from a weaker position with superior tactics, NOT micro-managing the user-interface.  So is it fun? Well, Frozen Synapse insists on you monitoring every sniffle and cough your troops make, so the majority of the time playing this game is spent staring at a screen of unmoving drones and identical walls, running simulation after simulation to determine the highest likely method of success. It would be just as fun to compare tax audits to determine which IRS agent was the most efficient!   Speaking of identical walls, the graphical quality of this game is terrible. I have never before claimed to need high quality graphics in a game, in fact in many ways the fight for ever greater graphics is ruining the industry, but if ever there was a game that needed better graphical design: this is it. The neon colors that honestly looked cool in the trailers and screencaps are horrendous to look at after only ten hours or so of gameplay. Every character looks the same, every wall is identical, you are a robot commander of a robot army killing other robots for no reason whatsoever.   Some of the positive reviews said the game was 'easy to get into, but hard to master,' and this is an outright lie. This game is hard to get into and hard to master. I will say it again: strategy games require simple controls so the only thing between you and victory is your tactics. Not fun.

I wanted to like this game. I bought the DLC for this game. The concept for this game is great and the writing is trash but I don't care. I made several false starts at learning this game, and I'm pretty sure I finally did, but the single player has an escort mission that involves an unrealistically bad area defense against way too many opponents, and it's like the third mission. It involves specialized units, which kill the game. Shotguns can't engage anything beyond about 20 feet even if you order them to. They don't miss, they just don't fire. At the same time, an enemy shotgun on the run will beat a readied assault rifle at close range, which basically means that by the rules I can't defend with the units the scenario gave me. There are no difficulty levels to adjust this.  BUY the soundtrack and not this game. You probably got it as part of a humble bundle, which is maybe what it deserved.  UPDATE: This game is addictive, though. While I was writing the review, I thought, oh, but what if I move my shotguns into base to fight the enemy shotguns and use my rifle to cover my flank? That shouldn't work, because of how far away they start my shotgun unit, but it's worth trying! And it turns out that no, an unready AI shotgun beats an already-aimed player shotgun.

I tend to enjoy turn based strategy games. However, in this case I really couldn't care how good the game is because the experience of trying to get to the game stage was so unpleseant that it ruid the entire experience for me.  Plus did I mention that I couldn't create a coop game? The first feature advertised on the sales screen. The option to create a coop game didn't even exist in the menu system. Friend had the option (and other options that I didn't, still don't know why) but when tried it gave the error 'You must have the expansion activated on the server to use this option.'  On top of that: * Tutorial was painful and at times insulting. They were going for sarcastic AI insulting the player for being bad at the game but the humor really didn't play that well. * They made me create an account specifically for the game. I don't want any more logins or accounts, please just let me authenticate through Steam. * VS mode was extremely unbalanced. Would start frequently one player is a very disadvantageous position.  Would love to see more turn based strategy games get a foothold in the market. But first they need to get the easy stuff right. You shouldn't loose a customer becuase your menu system stopped them from playing your game.
Just sucks. Too complex to long of a tutorial and really boring.

I was fairly disappointed in this title. I watched YouTube videos and read lots of reviews and was painted a different picture of the game than what I actually ended up with. It was constantly called a 'top-down Counter-Strike' but it was more like those Rainbow Six games-top-down. The tutorial doesn't do a great job of familiarizing the player with all of the game's features, which I think takes away from the long term success of this title as a multiplayer game. After spending so much time working out the perfect plan to own your adversary and watching it play out in a matter of seconds then seeing that plan fall apart before those seconds are even over I didn't have much motivation to experiment.  The multiplayer part of the game can be played somewhat at your leisure by opting to receive e-mail notifications when the enemy has taken their turn, but it's far from an exciting game that will keep you engaged. I found it to be more fun in short bursts.
very bad, unintuitive. not worth the time
